intro: Elegia deusta, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a striking plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often translucent petals that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. Elegia deusta thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a popular subject in botanical gardens and among plant enthusiasts.
